intro: Satureja granatensis, commonly known as granate thyme, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features small, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. Its leaves are aromatic, often used in traditional medicine and culinary applications. Satureja granatensis thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy plant suitable for rocky or alpine environments.
